captions.text:
-And as you all may
or may not know,

Father's Day is
coming up this month.

So we thought we would
do a really cool video.

It's kind of-- I don't really
know what you'd call it.

Like, how much do
you really know
about your dad kind of video.

-And my mom came up
with some questions.

And she's going to be
asking me and Bailey

-And then, he's going
to be giving the answers

to the questions to see how much
we really know about our dad.

It's also celebrated
as Cinco de Mayo.

-He got-- did he get
a master's degree?

-I graduated with a master's
of international management.

So I went to a college and
received my four year degree

with a minor in Spanish
as well, and then

got a master's in
international management.

So 12-- let me see
if I can do the math.
So it was a russet potato.

-He sang us his high
school song and danced

My high school
mascot was a russet.

And for anybody who doesn't
know what a russet it,

Yes, that was my
high school mascot.

-He eats a lot of
different things.

He eats so many
different things.

-My favorite food is
something that I've loved ever

since I was a kid growing
up in the farms of Idaho.

It's roast and potatoes,
just a farm boy at heart.
I know he can do that one.

All I know is he does
laundry sometimes,
I don't ever see him doing--

-So we're going to go
with car maintenance.
Oh, I'm going to go with--

-I say international travel
because he's done it so much.

-No, I think that's why he
wouldn't want to do that.

-No, but then he
likes visiting places.

I've actually been quite
a few places in the world,

and it's just something
that I thoroughly enjoy.

-Yeah, his friend knew
my mom's roommate.

And they went and
stopped at her house.

So they went and knocked on
her door and asked for water.

-They met, and now
they are married.

-I met Mindy when
we were in college.

And I was rollerblading
around the campus,

and we stopped at her
dorm room for water.

And she walked in,
and she just thought

I was the most handsome,
rugged looking guy.

-If I had $1,000, I
would definitely save it.

-Definitely dad likes to
watch football of any sport.

And he told us that
when he was like 14,
he went to his neighbor's house.

And he would carry pipe across
the fields back and forth.

And he didn't get paid
much, but he got paid.
So it counts as a job.

-My first job was moving
pipe in the potato fields.
I was about 12 when I started.

I'm going to go with
take care of his family.

-My biggest goal currently is
to raise all six of my children

-I just can't remember
what bothers him.

I don't have an
answer to this one.
That's all I can think of.

be when Mindy squeezes
the toothpaste
from the top of the tube.

-He likes to watch these
History Channel things

where they inform you
about crazy things that

-I'm going to go
with History Channel.

-I like watching Bizarre
Foods with Andrew Zimmeran.

to have eaten some
strange foods,

and that shows is
just pretty awesome.

-He eats too many
different kinds of stuff.
-He just likes a lot of things.
-So that's a hard one to answer.

-Cinco de Mayo, because
it's his birthday!

-No, I would have
gone with Christmas.

-Ever since I was
a kid, I've always

loved the Christmas season,
everything from Thanksgiving

all the way up to Christmas,
I just really loved that.

Especially with little kids, and
watching them enjoy the season.
He had lots of dogs, pets.
-Do we have to name the name?

And it was a really
common name, too.
I can only think of Spot.

-So when I was about
in second grade,

my dad came home
with a little puppy.

And he woke us up and
said it was a surprise.

We looked outside, and we
saw a little, white puppy.

He looked like a
little cute polar bear.

So we named him Bear, and
he was my favorite dog ever.

And I think we had him for
about six months before he
got run over by a car.

-Let's go with scariest because
he usually tells scary--

-There was one about
the heart in the wall.

When he was little,
he was sleeping,

and he thought he heard
a heart in the wall.

-Thumping, so he ran
to his parents' room.
And then, there wasn't a heart.
And he did this three times.

And then finally, when he
went to find the heart,

he realized that it was his own
heart pumping that scared him.

Or there's the children
in the stairs where

he's at night again,
and he's sleeping.
So he goes and gets his parents.

And they don't find anything,
and they keep doing this.

And then he follows the noise
and finds this little door
beneath the stairs and opens it.

-And there was the one where
he was like, it was dark.

And he wanted to
get a shortcut home.

So he crossed his
neighbor's yard.

And as he was crossing
through the yard,

he saw these red eyes
come towards him.

And at the end of the
story, he goes, rah!
And he's like, gah, my hand!

The kids always liked
it a little scary.

So I had this story
that I would tell them

that was called
Heart in the Wall.

And it was where
we told them that--

or, I told them that
our house was brand new.

And one of the
construction workers

died on set-- or, on the
job-- and they buried him

And sometimes,
late at night, you

can hear the little
[HEART BEATING] in the wall.

And then, as I would leave,
about 10 minutes later,
I would go bang on the wall.
It was a lot of fun.

-So hard working, mm,
I wouldn't say silly,
but he likes to goof off.

-And then, he'll want us to
say this one, good looking.

But we have his
eyes and eyelashes.
So I can't really say this.
But you have his patience level.

I'm super impatient, and
she's always patient.
Lots of different ways, I guess.

And they're beautiful,
so they're not like me.

But they do have a
great sense of humor,

and they can sing, which I think
I had something to do with.

-I ordered one for him
just the other day!
I know the name of this one.

-My favorite Sonic drink is
the Route 44 Ocean Water.

So we're going to
go with Superman.

-Ever since I was a
kid, I liked Superman.

I would want to be
a cartoon Superman.

-I'm going to go
with night person

because he usually stays
up late and then sleeps

-Well, not like a
lot of sleeping.

But he stays up later
than me, and more
So I'm going to go with night.

-I would say I'm definitely
a morning person.
In fact, you can ask my kids.

I'd come in in the morning
and I would sing to them,

(SINGING) it's time to
wake up in the morning.
It's time to wake up in the day!

It's time to wake
up, my sweet darling.

Then, I would spray them
with the water bottle.

And their feet had to hit the
floor before the song was done,
I'm going to go with no.

Because he was a dancer
because he has so many sisters.

So I'm sure he can
touch his toes.
He's kind of an old guy now!

I don't know if he
can touch his toes.
-Of course I can touch my toes.
He likes to sing a lot.

And he's good at
editing, obviously,
because he helps us edit a lot.

Carving pumpkins, he's
really good at that.
He's really good at math, too.

He's good at lots
of things, actually.

Thank you, Dad, for
doing this video with us.

-I couldn't ask for better
twins than Brooklyn and Bailey.

-Also, don't forget
to leave a comment

below on what you guys
like about your dads.
We would love to hear about it.

And also, don't forget to
like, share, and favorite.

And we'll see you
guys next week.

-This is one of my
favorites from-- they're

I was really excited when they
came out with the all red bag,
because I just love the reds.

But then, they came
out with these.
